channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Israel Says It Recovered Bodies of 6 Hostages in Gaza
item.description: The bodies were retrieved in an overnight operation in southern Gaza, the Israeli military said. Five of the hostages were already known to have died in captivity.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Israeli and Hamas Officials See Little Chance for Cease-Fire Breakthrough
item.description: As the Biden administration expressed optimism, the two sides said major disagreements remained unresolved. The U.S. secretary of state pushed for a deal in visits to Egypt and Qatar.

item.title: United Auto Workers boss threatens Stellantis strike, says car giant reneged on its promise to restart an assembly plant outside of Chicago
item.description: “The UAW will take whatever action necessary at Stellantis or any other corporation to stand up and hold corporate America accountable,” Shawn Fain said at the DNC Tuesday.

item.title: Maria Branyas Morera, World’s Oldest Person, Dies at 117
item.description: Ms. Morera, who cultivated a following on social media as “Super Catalan Grandma,” died peacefully in her sleep, her family said.

item.title: Israel Says It Recovered Bodies of 6 Hostages in Gaza
item.description: The bodies were retrieved in an overnight operation in southern Gaza, the Israeli military said. Five of the hostages were already known to have died in captivity.

item.title: Finance firms decamping for south Florida have created an elite school vacuum. Vanderbilt now seeks to fill it
item.description: A shortage of elite school options has been a major pain point for younger wealthy families who’ve moved to South Florida to work at firms such as Citadel, Blackstone, and Goldman Sachs.

item.title: What to Know About the Sunken Sicily Yacht’s Missing Passengers, Including Mike Lynch
item.description: Mr. Lynch, the former chief executive of the software firm Autonomy, who was acquitted on fraud charges in June, was with friends and family when the yacht went down in a severe storm.

item.title: Rocket Test on Remote Scottish Island Ends in Flames
item.description: As European countries push to develop more independent space capabilities, a test at one new site produced an explosion.

item.title: BurgerFi says it may file for bankruptcy
item.description: That would also be bad news for Anthony’s Coal Fired Pizza.

item.title: He Regulated Medical Devices. She Represented Their Makers.
item.description: Ethics rules barred Dr. Jeffrey E. Shuren from working on matters involving clients of his wife’s law firm. But he did not always step aside.

item.title: Maria Branyas Morera, World’s Oldest Person, Dies at 117
item.description: Ms. Morera, who cultivated a following on social media as “Super Catalan Grandma,” died peacefully in her sleep, her family said.

item.title: Transgender New Hampshire girl allowed to play soccer, judge rules, challenging governor’s ‘fairness in women’s sports’ law
item.description: The families of Parker Tirrell, 15, and Iris Turmelle, 14, filed a lawsuit seeking to overturn the “Fairness in Women’s Sports Act” that Republican Gov. Chris Sununu signed into law.

item.title: Zelensky Says Ukraine Now Controls About 480 Square Miles of Russian Territory
item.description: President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine seized on the incursion’s success to press allies to lift a longtime restriction: the use of Western-supplied long-range weapons against Russia.

item.title: Horticulturist Carlos Magdalena Is Saving Rare Flowers From Extinction
item.description: Carlos Magdalena, whose botanical adventures have shades of Indiana Jones, was a driving force in saving the world’s smallest water lily and finding the largest one. He has been called the “plant messiah.”

item.title: Elon Musk says he’ll take a job in the Trump cabinet if offered
item.description: Trump has publicly floated the idea.
